bestBHT.bht: Our Lord emphasizes the equality of all those sent in His name and challenges His disciples to deepen their self-renouncing nature. This turning point in His journey to Jerusalem involves teaching and performing miracles. Though arranging the separate incidents may be challenging, the lesson of toleration in methods of work for Christ is timeless. The proverbial saying Against you is for you reminds us not to hinder those who work for the Lord, as anyone not against us is actually on our side.

Henry Alford: Our Lord had declared the absolute equality of all sent in His name—and that if there were any difference, it was to be made by a deeper self-renouncing.

He takes this journey, beginning its narrative at the very same place where the others do, as comprehending—as indeed in strict historical fact it did—the last solemn farewell to Galilee, the final resolve of our Lord to go up to Jerusalem, and all the records which he possessed of miracles and discourses between this time and the triumphal entry.

As to arranging or harmonizing the separate incidents contained in this portion, as the Evangelist himself has completely by his connecting words in many places disclaimed it, I do not suppose that we, at this distance of time, shall succeed in doing so.
Archibald T. Robertson: Against you is for you" (καθ' υμων υπερ υμων).
The point is precisely the same as it is a proverbial saying.
The lesson of toleration in methods of work for Christ is needed today.
John Gill: Forbid not him, or any other so doing.
For he that is not against us, is for us.
The Vulgate Latin, and Syriac versions, instead of 'us', in both clauses read 'you'.

bhtAttempts.bht: Our Lord emphasizes the equality of all those sent in His name, challenging His disciples to deepen their self-renouncing nature. This journey in Luke 9:50 marks the significant turning point of His resolve to go up to Jerusalem, where he taught and performed miracles. While the alignment of separate incidents may prove challenging due to the Evangelist's disclaimer, the timeless lesson of toleration in methods of work for Christ stands today. Against you is for you conveys the proverbial truth that those who do not oppose us are on our side. The Latin and Syriac versions substitute you instead of us. It is a reminder to not forbid or hinder those who are working for the Lord, as anyone not against us is for us.

Our Lord emphasizes the equality of all those sent in His name, challenging His disciples to deepen their self-renouncing nature. This journey marks the significant turning point of His resolve to go up to Jerusalem, teaching and performing miracles along the way. While the alignment of separate incidents may prove challenging, the timeless lesson of toleration in methods of work for Christ stands today. Against you is for you, conveying the proverbial truth that those who do not oppose us are on our side. It is a reminder to not forbid or hinder those who are working for the Lord, as anyone not against us is for us.

Our Lord stresses the equality of His disciples, calling for a deeper self-renunciation. This journey signifies His resolve to go to Jerusalem, where He taught and performed miracles. While it may be challenging to harmonize the separate incidents in this portion, the lesson of toleration in methods of work for Christ remains relevant today. The saying Against you is for you highlights the idea that those who do not oppose us are actually on our side. It serves as a reminder to embrace and support those who are working for the Lord.

This turning point in His journey to Jerusalem involves teaching and performing miracles. Though arranging the separate incidents may be challenging, the lesson of toleration in methods of work for Christ is timeless. The proverbial saying Against you is for you reminds us not to hinder those who work for the Lord, as anyone not against us is actually on our side.

Our Lord emphasizes the equality of those sent in His name and calls for a deeper self-renunciation. This significant journey to Jerusalem includes teachings and miracles. While arranging separate incidents may prove challenging, the lesson of toleration in methods of work for Christ remains crucial. The proverbial saying Against you is for you reminds us not to hinder those working for the Lord, for anyone not against us is actually on our side.
